q: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.

“True wealth is of the heart, not of the purse.” —
Og Mandino

q: If ever you feel like an animal among men, be a lion.
h:
“If ever you feel like an animal among men, be a lion.” —
Criss Jami

q: Speak when you are angry - and you'll make the best speech you'll ever regret.
h:
“Speak when you are angry - and you'll make the best speech you'll ever regret.” —
Laurence J. Peter

q: Your work is to discover your work and then, with all your heart, to give yourself to it.
h:
“Your work is to discover your work and then, with all your heart, to give yourself to it.” —
Buddha

q: I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.
h:
“I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Start the day with love, spend the day with love, fill the day with love and end the day with love.
h:
“Start the day with love, spend the day with love, fill the day with love and end the day with love.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
h:
“The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.” —
William James

q: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.
h:
“People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Don't stop when you're tired. Stop when you're done.
h:
“Don't stop when you're tired. Stop when you're done.” —
Marilyn Monroe

q: You can live a whole life time never being awake.
h:
“You can live a whole life time never being awake.” —
Dan Millman

q: Unless you change how you are, you will always have what you got.
h:
“Unless you change how you are, you will always have what you got.” —
Jim Rohn

q: When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing.
h:
“When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing. ” —
Zen Proverb

q: Mastering others is strength, mastering yourself is true power.
h:
“Mastering others is strength, mastering yourself is true power.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Rest and be kind, you don't have to prove anything.
h:
“Rest and be kind, you don't have to prove anything.” —
Jack Kerouac

q: You have to make time, even for something as universal as staring at the stars.
h:
“You have to make time, even for something as universal as staring at the stars.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: Surround yourself with people who take their work seriously, but not themselves, those who work hard and play hard.
h:
“Surround yourself with people who take their work seriously, but not themselves, those who work hard and play hard.” —
Colin Powell

q: Man's character is his fate.
h:
“Man's character is his fate.” —
Heraclitus

q: We cannot always do great things in life, but we can do small things with great love.
h:
“We cannot always do great things in life, but we can do small things with great love.” —
Dan Millman

q: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
h:
“Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: If you see a get rich quick scheme, that's someone else trying to get rich off of you.
h:
“If you see a get rich quick scheme, that's someone else trying to get rich off of you.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
h:
“The truth is rarely pure and never simple. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Confidence is consistency of thinking about what is possible and how to make it possible.
h:
“Confidence is consistency of thinking about what is possible and how to make it possible.” —
John Eliot

q: Do not follow the ideas of others, but learn to listen to the voice within yourself.
h:
“Do not follow the ideas of others, but learn to listen to the voice within yourself.” —
Dogen

q: The river that flows in you also flows in me.
h:
“The river that flows in you also flows in me.” —
Kabir

q: If you care about someone enough, you'll always be there for them no matter what.
h:
“If you care about someone enough, you'll always be there for them no matter what.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
h:
“Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
h:
“Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
h:
“Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.
h:
“People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed.
h:
“Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed.” —
William Faulkner

q: Some of the greater things in life are unseen; that's why you close your eyes when you kiss, cry, or dream.
h:
“Some of the greater things in life are unseen; that's why you close your eyes when you kiss, cry, or dream.” —
Unknown

q: You can't get to a place that you don't believe exists.
h:
“You can't get to a place that you don't believe exists.” —
Unknown

q: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
h:
“Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.” —
George Addair

q: The more perfect a person is on the outside, the more demons they have on the inside.
h:
“The more perfect a person is on the outside, the more demons they have on the inside.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Silence is a source of great strength.
h:
“Silence is a source of great strength.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Successful people appreciate where they have come from, but they don't let their past set the tone for their future.
h:
“Successful people appreciate where they have come from, but they don't let their past set the tone for their future.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Sometimes letting things go is an act of far greater power than defending or hanging on.
h:
“Sometimes letting things go is an act of far greater power than defending or hanging on.” —
Eckhart Tolle
